ygData.subject: Re: Teleporting
ygData.msgSnippet: ... On a humorous side note, I had just feigned after a bad pull in Cazic, when the screen went to the Loading please wait...  I was stumped, because I didn t
ygData.messageBody:
Tony Donatelli wrote:
>
> From: "Tony Donatelli" <donatea@...>
>
> > ANYWAY...
> > I also dread a teleport to Faydwer for the same reason.
> > I have no idea what NPCs hang around wizard teleport
> > rings. I doubt I will ever use a Druidic Succor for
> > obvious reasons. My wife's Bard worships Veeshan, and
> > when teleported to the Druidic ring in the Karanas she
> > was KoSed. With my lag I would never see that I am
> > being attacked, just the "Returning to home point..."
> > message.
>
> I have no idea if this will ease your fears or not, but the only person who
> can't be invisible when teleporting or succoring is the caster. In other
> words, you can be invis and still ride along. I'm a dark elf SK who's killed
> many many druids, yet I just go invis during his casting, and I still get to
> tag along. Just a little trick so when you get 30, you can invis yourself
> and not have to miss out on teleporting. :)
>
> Dravith Vandre'i
>

On a humorous side note, I had just feigned after a bad pull in Cazic,
when the screen went to the Loading please wait... I was stumped,
because I didn't see me die, until I looked up and saw the druid say
that he was evac'ing. At first I was overjoyed at his timely salvation,
until I remembered what hangs around druid circles.

Needless to say, he teleported me back to get my body from East Karanas.
I told him to let the wiz evac us next time =)

Xilith
